author: a35u
content: I noticed that, it seemed like it re-synced a few times. It was showing those blocks before though. but then over night a few days ago my misses went from 19 to 85, days after the merge actually happened and now I see a bunch missing from epoch 911-985

author: dv8s
content: base fee on goerli is only 7 -- I think 2-4 hours until the shadow fork merge? It shouldn't take long to get the base fee up right

author: dv8s
content: 1266 difficulty left.  is the difficulty of a goerli block ( 1 vs 2) random?

author: timbeiko
content: It can 10x every ~5 minutes, so in 10 minutes it should be sufficient.

author: ajsutton
content: Semi-random.  If Clique is working properly is should always be 2, but GÃ¶rli has exposed a number of problems with Clique (and there's some rather poor implementations that don't help), plus some validators are often often.  All of which leads to a lot of out of turn blocks with a difficulty of 1.

author: ajsutton
content: So not really random, but still pretty unpredictable.

author: a35u
content: I think it is worth making sure the beacon explorer is 100% merge ready too as that's one of the primary ways people will judge if the merge is successful (whether or not it's correct)

author: parithosh
content:
^ just waking up so I've only got preliminary info. 

Goerli shadow fork was a success, chain is finalizing and healthy proposal numbers. 

I forgot to add a jwt secret to node connected to the beaconexplorer, so everything just crashed when it tried to use the engine api(oops). This just happened because the explorer runs on the bootnode and I tend to set up bootnodes manually. It's been fixed now, but the remnant of the forgetfullnes exists in the missing attestation+proposals from when the node was down. I'll rebuild that db in a bit. 

I'll update everyone with a more detailed split about client performance, etc after I'm properly awake ðŸ˜…

author: parithosh
content: Looks like we went down from 99.6% participation to ~85%, not too bad considering we have mainnet split and far higher load than previous testnets. I think some clients already said they knew things that might break. I'll see if there were unexpected issues.

author: dv8s
content: Nice!
